text: Hey, y'all. I won't be in this am, fighting a migraine. Will catch up in the afternoon though.
Gah. Good luck Dennis
Those are terrible
<!channel> I put additional 4K footage on the LaCie last night. It's in that newest footage folder > 4K

Feel better Dennis!
Thanks Ewald
Headed in from SOS. All that waiting & I didn't have all my docs :rage:
I'm alive and headed in as well
Migrane over? Eeek <@U0ML49XU0> careful!
diving in, is there a cut more recent/relevant than whats on gdrive or should i view whats there?
i’m just catching up
also, want to see how we’re tracking towards sending a pic cut to google eod
Jason is going through the stuff Ewald shot.
cool, is swapping out those shots all thats left before ‘post’ stuff?

Here's all my stuff before post: 
- New footage for Ewald to shoot & me to include
    - Data viz
    - Cubby - PINK
        - plane
        - cord falling
    - Shots in draft singled out
- Take out any shots with banding (00:16)
- People walking across floor
- Low priority: Dennis looking into cubby, then Angela interacting with cubby….anything we can do? Try switching shots?
ok cool, let me know if i can help. pls advise if we’re NOT going to be able to have somethign for review tonight and we’ll look at necessary adjustments.
<!channel> - on lunch break. Anything I can help with?
hey <@U0265G76F> the team is in a lunch and learn but I’ll use this time to check in with you on some higher -level stuff
cool

- you’ve reviewed the case study.  it’s in a final round of review by Justin before we float with google for final approval.  
- in talking with <@U02F9CXTL> about your footage, he thinks the insets won’t really change any of the story or timeline.  if this is the case, i still think you and justin should review tomorrow AM before we send to google.  
- Megan B is putting together blog posts and socail content to share with james/today tomorrow.  This needs to be reviewed before it’s sent to google.
sound good to you or need more info or more reviews on anything?
sounds good. i was more wondering if footage and sound needs are good
yeah, that i can’t speak to yet, jason’s in it and will report out.  i just wanted to check in on the program of deliverables
cool
thanks
all sounds good

<!here|@here> i just booked a final video (timeline) for tomorrow morning at 11.  the idea is to reach consensus for picture lock(!) so we can proceed with google approvals and post.  

One decision point: we're currently using a blend of AE and live shot Top Sweep footage.  At :42 there's an AE insert that can either stay as is, be re-shot live and sswapped in or we can decide to use all AE for Top Sweep.

Once we bottom out on this, this timeline can be exported as picture lock for google approval and a reference for Emily to update her Premier file.  

We'll also check back in on Emily's progress on post.  a heads up <@U0J6TE0CA> it’s my understanding all the previoulsy noted non-post work is done
Yep I have been working on post today
I’ll do my best to make it, I just need to connect with Marce on the conflict I have at that time
Also in the spirit of transparency, met briefly with Trent about logo animations & we have a plan of attack to propose for going forward.
if I can’t make it - my official, Design Director vote is that we gain literally nothing by slavish adherence to a specific mode of animation on a project like this.
if the AE looks good, use the AE
if we want to get into the rationale for why we might use AE in some places and shot footage in another we can, but again, with something like this, the end all, be all is: does it look good
Good news: it looks dank. Also, it's only one shot. Should we change our meeting time <@U0ML49XU0> ?
im with justin, i think it works as is.  This review is moslty last looks for Ewald though if he wants to review remotely, that’s fine.
No need for Justin and Ewald both there, I’d love to not bog this process down with another meetingbut i appreciate that every live convo has been helpful thus far.
